results.description: Use short-sale trigger time recent change as immediate signal. SUGGESTION1: not applied (only one datafield available). SUGGESTION2: not applied (field is scalar, not vector). SUGGESTION3: applied ts_backfill due to low coverage (0.2573) to reduce missingness. SUGGESTION4: used because userCount=72 and alphaCount=122 indicate familiar field. Confidence: 0.60 — recent changes in trigger time often indicate immediate short-interest dynamics.
Momentum of trigger times over 5 days. S1: only one field. S2: not vector. S3: applied ts_backfill(d=20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.62 — multi-day momentum smooths noise.

Z-score of backfilled trigger time over 10 days to standardize across names. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.65 — zscoring reduces cross-instrument dispersion and outliers.
Delta divided by time-series stddev to account for volatility. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.60 — volatility scaling stabilizes signal magnitude.
Days since last change highlights stale vs fresh triggers. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.55 — freshness often correlates with actionable moves.

Number of missing recent values to measure data sparsity/illiquidity. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30) then ts_count_nans on raw to estimate true sparsity. S4: applied. Confidence: 0.45 — sparsity indicates lower reliability but can be predictive for infrequent events.

Detect if today's value is the maximum in last 7 days (fresh high trigger). S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(14). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.58 — new highs in trigger timing may precede pressure.

Detect if today's value is the minimum in last 7 days (fresh low trigger). S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(14). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.56 — new lows may indicate easing of short pressure.
Use the 10-day mean of trigger time as a smoothed level. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.52 — smoothing reduces noise for position sizing.

results.idea: Signal based on recent acceleration (delta of deltas)
results.description: Second-order change captures acceleration in trigger time shifts. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.57 — acceleration can be an early warning.

Cross-sectional quantile of backfilled trigger time to select relative extremes. S1: limited to one field but still cross-sectional across names. S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.63 — relative ranking robust to scale differences.
Negative 3-day delta flags decrease in trigger time (possible easing). S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.50 — directional but requires calibration.
Current minus 30-day mean to catch medium-term shifts. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.59 — medium-term deviations often mean-revert.

Change in short-sale trigger stddev (10d vs 30d) to detect volatility regime shifts. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.55 — regime shifts signal higher risk/opportunity.
Only trade when a fresh trigger occurs (arg_max == 0). S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(14). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.54 — gating reduces turnover and focuses on actionable events.
Use inverse of days-from-last-change so very recent changes get higher weight. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.53 — emphasizes freshest signals.
Use sign of 3d delta to get direction only (reduce magnitude sensitivity). S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.50 — simple robust directionality.
Winsorize raw backfilled value then zscore to control outliers. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.61 — improves robustness to extreme timestamps.
Scale current vs 5-day min/max to detect mean reversion extremes. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.57 — normalized extremes tend to revert.

Product of small daily changes to expose persistent directional movement. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.48 — product can be noisy but captures persistence.
Use ts_ir over 20 days to find stable signals (mean/std). S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(40). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.64 — IR identifies names with consistent directional moves.

Rank each instrument by 3-day series to detect relative short-term behavior. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(10). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.60 — cross-sectional rank reduces scale effects.
Current minus recent max to detect pullbacks from highs. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.52 — identifies names below recent peaks.

Backfill using kth_element to take last valid instead of first in backfill when coverage sparse. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied kth_element with k=1 to mitigate missingness. S4: applied. Confidence: 0.50 — alternative backfill may be more representative for sparse fields.
Decay-weighted average emphasizes more recent triggers. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.58 — decay weighting gives faster responsiveness.
Apply hump to raw backfilled delta to limit turnover. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.54 — reduces transaction costs and noise trades.

Cross-sectional zscore of 7d mean to pick extremes. S1: limited single field but cross-section used; S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.62 — zscore across names picks relative outliers.

results.idea: Trigger clustering indicator (count of recent non-NaNs)
results.description: Count of valid trigger days signals clustering of events. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: used raw ts_count_nans inverted by subtracting from window length. S4: applied. Confidence: 0.49 — clustering of events can indicate sustained pressure.

Difference from 30d mean divided by 30d std to create standardized momentum. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.61 — standardization improves comparability.
Signal = 1 when 2d delta negative (reversal candidate), else 0. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(14). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.47 — simple contrarian rule.
Flag days with absolute 1d delta above recent std * factor. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.58 — jumps often precede continuation or reversal.

Zscore of ts_returns over 5 days to standardize relative moves. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(15). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.56 — returns capture proportional change rather than absolute time.
Trade when today's value is the max and delta positive (confirm breakout). S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(14). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.60 — confirmation reduces false positives.

results.idea: Mean reversion score (reverse of 7d av diff)
results.description: Use negative of 7d average deviation to go against extremes. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.55 — mean reversion plausible for these signals.

Prefer names with low 60d stddev (stable history) and use delta as signal. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(120). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.58 — stable histories yield more reliable signals.
Compute ts_quantile over 5d to detect percentile extremes. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(10). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.60 — percentile breakout highlights relative moves.

results.idea: Trigger momentum normalized by mean absolute dev
results.description: Delta divided by ts_std_dev approximates signal-to-noise. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(40). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.59 — improves signal reliability.
Multiply signs of 1d and 3d deltas to require alignment. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.53 — alignment filter reduces noise.
Apply decay then compute zscore for responsiveness and standardization. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(40). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.62 — combines recency and normalization.
Winsorize deltas to clip outliers then use sign for direction. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.54 — clipping prevents extreme outlier influence.

results.idea: Mean normalized reversal (short-term vs long-term mean)
results.description: Difference between 5d mean and 30d mean (mean reversion candidate). S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.57 — cross-horizon difference useful for reversion.
High kurtosis indicates occasional large jumps—use ts_kurtosis. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(120). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.46 — kurtosis is noisy but flags tail behavior.
Use ts_mean of winsorized series to reduce outlier bias. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60) then winsorize. S4: applied. Confidence: 0.56 — trimmed mean is robust.
Sum of signs over 7 days to measure persistent direction. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(14). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.52 — persistence often indicates continuation.
Bucket 3-day rank into discrete buckets for simpler trading rules. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(10). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.51 — bucketing reduces sensitivity to small changes.

Zscore of delta-of-delta to find accelerating moves standardized by recent variability. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.58 — acceleration standardized is predictive.
Require delta > std and arg_max recent to confirm breakout. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.61 — dual confirmation reduces false signals.
Use pasteurize to clip INF or invalid and then compute delta. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.50 — ensures invalid values don't poison signal.
Count how often sign of delta changed over recent window (instability metric). S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(40). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.47 — frequent sign flips indicate noise.

results.idea: Short-window mean vs previous (shifted mean diff)
results.description: Difference between current 3d mean and previous 3d mean to catch shift. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.55 — captures short regime shifts.
Signed power of acceleration emphasizes large same-sign accelerations. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(40). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.49 — non-linear emphasis may help rare events.

results.idea: Recent median deviation (kth element for median)
results.description: Use kth_element to approximate median then compute diff to current. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied kth_element(shrt24_triggertime_2, 30, 2) as backfill approach. S4: applied. Confidence: 0.51 — median robust to outliers.
Information ratio on ts_returns over 14d to find persistent movers. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.63 — IR isolates consistent trends.

results.idea: Trigger gap detection (absolute jump from delayed value)
results.description: Absolute difference from lagged value to detect one-day gaps. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(10). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.57 — gaps often indicate sudden events.
Smooth with 3d mean then zscore across instruments. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(15). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.60 — smoothing plus standardization is robust.
Detect when value is new low but delta turns positive (rebound). S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.54 — identifies bounce setups.
Ratio of short-term std to long-term std to detect regime change. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(120). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.56 — relative volatility is informative.

Binary indicator if backfilled value exists (improves coverage handling). S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30) then is_nan to detect missingness. S4: applied. Confidence: 0.44 — helps mask names with insufficient data.

results.idea: Short-term product of delta and inverse std
results.description: Multiply delta by inverse of short std to overweight strong moves in quiet names. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.57 — increases signal-to-noise.
Aggregate recent triggers by summing backfilled series over 14 days. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.50 — cumulative counts indicate sustained activity.
Require low missingness and a strong delta to trade. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30) and ts_count_nans used raw. S4: applied. Confidence: 0.55 — filters out unreliable names.

results.idea: Short-term relative rank (cross-section rank of 3d mean)
results.description: Group-neutral cross-sectional rank via rank of 3d mean (no group data available). S1/S2: limited but cross-sectional applied. S3: applied ts_backfill(15). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.62 — cross-sectional rank robust for selection.
Go against names where acceleration turns negative after strong positive delta. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(40). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.53 — conditional contrarian approach.

results.idea: Recent normalized gap (divide by long std)
results.description: One-day gap divided by long-term std to standardize importance. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(120). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.56 — standardization helps cross-name comparison.

Approximate vector-style averaging by taking average of intraday/backfilled daily values via ts_mean. S1/S2: true vector not available; used ts_mean instead. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.48 — crude proxy to intraday aggregation.
Bucket 5d momentum into coarse buckets for rule-based trading. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(15). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.52 — discretization reduces noise.
Mean divided by variance to prefer consistent directional movers. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(120). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.60 — favors predictable names.

If short std spikes relative to long std and delta negative, signal reversal. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(120). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.50 — conditional contrarian trade after spikes.
Require sign of 1d and 7d deltas to match before acting. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.55 — alignment increases conviction.

results.idea: Trigger gap normalized to recent median absolute deviation
results.description: Use MAD-like scale by dividing gap by ts_std_dev (proxy). S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.54 — robust scaling of gaps.
Downweight momentum for names with many recent NaNs. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30) and ts_count_nans. S4: applied. Confidence: 0.53 — improves reliability.
Signal when series crosses its 5d mean (trend inception). S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.56 — crossing events often mark regime change.

results.idea: Short-run trend multiplied by stability score
results.description: Multiply short-run delta by inverse of 30d std to favor stable names. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.58 — combines trend with reliability.
Flag names with persistent missingness for exclusion. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied (no backfill) to detect true sparsity. S4: applied. Confidence: 0.40 — useful for risk control not alpha.
If a name hits recent max, signal reversal using negative delta to capture mean reversion. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.52 — contrarian after spikes.
Measure if arg_min and arg_max are far apart indicating strong trend. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.48 — heuristic for strong moves.

results.idea: Short-term mean reversion scaled (divide by ts_count_nans)
results.description: Use mean-reversion signal but downweight if many NaNs show unreliability. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(40). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.53 — robust weighting.

results.idea: Trigger momentum vs its own volatility zscore
results.description: Zscore of delta divided by its recent std to find statistically significant moves. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.60 — statistical significance filtering.
Weighted persistence combining sign and magnitude over 7 days. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.51 — captures sustained directional magnitude.

results.idea: Short-term range breakout (current outside past range)
results.description: Detect if current value outside past 10-day min/max by using ts_arg_max/min heuristic. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.59 — breakouts often predict continuation.
Clip small deltas to zero to focus on meaningful moves via tail operator. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.50 — reduces micro-noise.

results.idea: Short-run multiplier using inverse coverage proxy
results.description: Use ts_count_nans as inverse coverage proxy to downweight names with poor coverage. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill for values; ts_count_nans used raw. S4: applied. Confidence: 0.48 — pragmatic risk control.

Require consistent sign and magnitude across 1d and 2d deltas via multiplication. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.54 — multiplicative confirmation useful.

results.idea: Trend persistence zscore (sum of deltas zscored)
results.description: Sum recent deltas then zscore across instruments. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.61 — aggregates evidence then normalizes.

results.idea: Short-run reversal on high kurtosis days
results.description: If kurtosis high (rare jumps), take contrarian small-position reversal. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(120). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.45 — risky but can capture overreactions.

results.idea: Recent co-movement proxy (autocovariance via ts_covariance with lagged self)
results.description: Use ts_covariance between series and its 1-day lag to measure autocorrelation. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.50 — autocovariance indicates inertia.
Measure days since extremum via ts_arg_max to quantify persistence. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.49 — helps timing entries after extremes.
Scale delta by sqrt inverse std to favor strong moves in quiet names. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.56 — nonlinear scaling accentuates signal.
Winsorize 3d delta then bucket into discrete trading bands. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.52 — simple execution-friendly rule.

results.idea: Recent-run indicator using ts_step and sign
results.description: Use ts_step to measure days count and combine with sign to prefer long-lived trends. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.47 — heuristic to favor sustained trends.
Cross-sectional quantile of 3d delta to pick top breakouts. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(15). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.63 — selects relative movers robustly.
Compute delta then only keep it if 60d std in lower quantile (stable bucket). S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(120). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.55 — filters for reliable names.

Detect sign flip immediately after high absolute delta and signal contrarian trade. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.49 — targets short-lived overreactions.
Require recent activity (low NaNs) and breakout magnitude to act. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.56 — ensures active names only.
Zscore of 30d delta to capture sustained directional pressure. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(90). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.60 — longer horizon smooths noise.

Pasteurize then require delta > threshold to avoid INF or invalids. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30) then pasteurize. S4: applied. Confidence: 0.51 — robust handling of invalid data.
Delta divided by recent range (ts_max - ts_min) approximated via ts_scale denominator. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(60). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.55 — normalizes by amplitude.

results.idea: Short-run decisive move (abs delta > recent avg abs delta)
results.description: Flag moves larger than recent average absolute delta. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.57 — captures relatively big moves.
Combine sign with zscore to get signed standardized momentum. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.58 — mixes magnitude and direction robustly.

results.idea: Short-term reversal after sustained positive sum
results.description: If sum of signs over 10d strongly positive, signal small contrarian. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.46 — mean-reversion risk control.

results.idea: Weighted recent average (higher weight to latest via ts_decay_linear)
results.description: Use decay to weight recent days and take mean as signal. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(40). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.59 — responsive smoothed signal.
Only trade when zscored delta exceeds threshold to limit trades. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(30). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.62 — thresholding reduces noise.

results.idea: Short-term breakout with sign consistency across days
results.description: Require 3 consecutive same-sign deltas before acting. S1/S2: not applicable. S3: applied ts_backfill(20). S4: applied. Confidence: 0.54 — persistence filter improves hit-rate.
